titleStmt.title: H. F. Turner et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG7893

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Henderson Ky
Feby 13th 1863
To his Excellency
Gov Robinson --
Dear Sir --

Some time last Month -- the Office of Justice of the peace for the 5th district in this county was vacated by the resignation of S S Sizemore -- A petition was sent to your excelllency to appoint P. H. Lockett -- Since then we have had no acting Justice, in this district, that is one who keeps an office for that purpose --

Our county Judge has been absent for a week & expect to be absent for two more weeks
so that we are really in want of such an Officer -- Subdivision 2 Sec 5 Chap 32 of statutes gives you the power to appoint if you have not already done so -- Your early attention to fillilng said vacancy would confer a favor upon the people of this district.

Yours most truly
H. F. Turner
Y. E. Walken Co Judge Pro Tem
Sol. S. Sizemore Const
Y, E, Allison Cstn
Adam Rankin C. H. C. C.

Henderson Co
J. P.
Dist No 5
P. H. Lockett
Iss Feby 17. 1863
